template_description: Standard template for service_architecture.json files based on UAF definitions
purpose: Input/Output Controllers (IOCs) that interface directly with scientific instruments and provide EPICS Process Variables (PVs) for device control and monitoring. These are external systems that cannot be modified but provide the fundamental device interface layer.

interfaces.name: EPICS Process Variables
interfaces.description: EPICS Process Variables (PVs) for device control, status monitoring, and data acquisition
interfaces.source_verification: Based on standard EPICS IOC implementations in scientific facilities

interfaces.name: Channel Access Server
interfaces.description: EPICS Channel Access server providing network access to PVs for remote monitoring and control
interfaces.source_verification: Based on standard EPICS Channel Access server functionality

interfaces.name: Device Hardware Interface
interfaces.description: Hardware interface to scientific instruments including motors, detectors, and sensors
interfaces.source_verification: Based on standard IOC hardware interface patterns

interfaces.name: Database Configuration
interfaces.description: EPICS database records defining PV structure, limits, and processing logic
interfaces.source_verification: Based on standard EPICS database record configuration

additional_requirements: Network access control to IOC subnets

additional_info.external_system: Cannot be modified or directly managed
additional_info.deployment_environment: Dedicated IOC hardware or embedded systems
additional_info.maintenance: Managed by facility control systems team

resource_requirements.real_time_capability: Real-time response for device control operations
resource_requirements.reliability: High reliability for scientific instrument operation
resource_requirements.deterministic_behavior: Predictable response times for experimental control

verification_notes: Based on standard EPICS IOC implementations widely used in scientific facilities

justification.rationale: Essential external interface layer providing standardized access to scientific instrument hardware
justification.standards_reference: EPICS (Experimental Physics and Industrial Control System) - industry standard
justification.best_practices_reference: Separation of hardware interface from application control logic
justification.examples: Universally used in synchrotron facilities, particle accelerators, and large scientific experiments
justification.trade_offs: External system constraints vs. standardized, reliable instrument interface
